availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Ward (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier in 33rd and 26th KY)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Whiat Ward in Green County, Kentucky, on February 1, 1852. Father of David Ward, Sarah F. Ward, Elizabeth Ward, Permelia J. Ward, and Mary Ward. Laborer in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Hart County in 1860. Served in Company D 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from September 13, 1862, to April 1, 1864. Served in Company K 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from April 1, 1864, to May 25, 1865. In hospital at Troy, New York, from April 30 to May 25, 1865.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 383.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 405.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994036, Green County Marriages, p. 2.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 230-1, 233.
